settings.specialized__title: POSTPARTUM DEPRESSION AND POSTPARTUM HAIR LOSS
settings.specialized__top_content:
We've been honored to hear from thousands of real customers that our Hair Vitamins have helped them through their hair loss struggles.

People from around the world who've suffered from Postpartum in particular, have been kind enough to submit reviews and results highlighting their positive experiences with ST. TROPICA. And we want to pay it forward by sharing with anyone & everyone who also may be dealing with Postpartum.

Many of us may not know what Postpartum is, and may have concerns over being undiagnosed; or just excited to find a resource focused specifically on Postpartum and hair loss. So let's dive into it.
settings.specialized__review_title: My hair has grown almost 3 full inches
settings.specialized__review_content: I'm in my 3rd month of taking the biotin & superfoods blend from @sttropica and the regrowth at my hairline has been amazing. This isn’t my first experience with post-partum hair loss, after my first son was born I lost a lot of my hair especially at my hair line & it didn’t start to grow back until I was at least a year post partum. This time I’m 7 months post partum & my hair is growing like crazy. (side note) I got a haircut a few weeks ago so you can't really see the progress in my length, but my hair has grown almost 3 full inches and is curlier, shinier, & healthier looking than ever. My goal this year is to grow my hair as long as possible & I'm doing a few things to keep my hair strong enough so that I can go longer in between trims. I'm using the same products that I've always used & I am still avoiding heat styling but now I'm also deep conditioning my hair once per week & taking a daily vitamin.

settings.specialized__what_content:
Many new moms experience Postpartum after childbirth. In the first few days and weeks after childbirth it is not uncommon to experience mood swings, anxiety, restlessness when trying to sleep, and bouts of crying.

While some women recover within a few weeks from their Postpartum, others experience Postpartum depression which is is long lasting and requires medical attention.

settings.heading: What are the Symptoms of Postpartum Depression?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
• Feelings of sadness and depression
  • Mood swings
  • Excessive crying
  • Difficulty bonding with your newborn
  • Feeling withdrawn
  • A extreme loss or gain of appetite
  • Insomnia
  • Hopelessness
  • Feelings of worthlessness
  • Restlessness
  • Fatigue
  • Increased irritability
  • Severe anxiety
  • Panic attacks
  • Thoughts of harming yourself or your baby
  • Thoughts of death or suicide

settings.heading: What Should You Do If You Suspect You have Postpartum Depression?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans: If you are experiencing any of the symptoms noted above, or know someone who is experiencing these symptoms, immediately seek medical assistance.

settings.heading: Postpartum Hair Loss: What Causes Postpartum Hair Loss?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
While Postpartum hair loss is completely normal, we understand that it can be scary to notice hair loss and hair thinning.

The reason Postpartum hair loss occurs following your pregnancy is because during your pregnancy your hormones keep your hair from falling out as they regularly would.

Each day, the average person loses around 100 hairs but during pregnancy your hormones prevent this from happening. This means that during your pregnancy you'll find that your hair is fuller than before.

Once you've given birth, and the hormones in your body begin to regulate, you'll find that your hair will shed as it tries to go back to it's normal thickness and this is what is known as Postpartum hair loss.

Postpartum hair loss and new growth can be a jarring experience as you're both experiencing hair loss as well as new growth which means you'll find your hair is both thinning while also seeing an influx of new baby hairs coming in.

settings.heading: When Does Postpartum Hair Loss Start?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans: Postpartum hair loss begin the day that you give birth. However, it typically takes about 4 months to notice Postpartum hair loss and your hair can continue shedding for a full year.

settings.heading: When will Postpartum Hair Loss Regrowth Begin?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans: Typically around the 6-12 month you'll begin to notice new hair growth. These are often referred to as baby hairs or "baby bangs".

settings.heading: How to Limit Postpartum Hair Loss?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
There are many ways to limit and treat Postpartum hair loss. While the first step is to always address any health concerns you're having with your physician, there are also a few other ways you can care for your hair and prevent further hair loss or damage, these include:

Tips for Caring for Postpartum Hair:

  • Consult your physician about implementing a hair growth vitamin into your diet.
  • Refrain from using heat tools on your hair to avoid damage. Instead try heatless hairstyling methods or styles (like our classic braided bun) to style your hair.
  • Swap out your elastic bands for softer scrunchies to avoid pulling on the roots of your hair and causing more damage to the shaft and ends of your hair.
  • Use hot oil hair masks regularly to strengthen your hair and provide your scalp with a nutrient rich treatment.
  • Use a satin pillow case to prevent unnecessary scalp irritation or damage to the hair. Rough cotton pillow cases can be damaging to your hair and scalp.
